study_design.type: Mechanistic Bayesian Evidence Synthesis + Dynamic Treatment Regime Simulation
study_design.focus: Carbonic Anhydrase Inhibition Intensity in Idiopathic Intracranial Hypertension
study_design.data_sources: IIHTT RCT, AZD4017 trial, preclinical dose-response studies (Scotton 2019, Westgate 2024)

optimal_monotherapy.interpretation: Doses >2g provide minimal additional benefit (marginal gain 0.1-0.2 mmHg/g)

topiramate_potency.finding: TPM 8x more potent than ACZ per mg (ED50: 150mg vs 1200mg)
topiramate_potency.advantage: Added migraine prophylaxis + weight loss benefits

combination_synergy.interpretation: Strongest evidence for combination therapy in moderate-severe IIH

dose_response_plateau.clinical_implication: Routine escalation beyond 2g not justified except in refractory cases

mild_iih.recommendation: ACZ 1g monotherapy OR TPM 100mg if migraine comorbidity
mild_iih.rationale: Excellent efficacy at low dose, better tolerability, lower cost

moderate_iih.rationale: Evidence-based RCT dose, combination superior if inadequate response

severe_iih.expected_outcomes: 65% ICP normalization, surgery avoided in majority
severe_iih.rationale: Synergistic benefit critical, monotherapy inadequate (10-15% normalization only)
severe_iih.escalation: Consider ACZ 3g + TPM 200mg if inadequate, early surgical consult

combination_tolerability.recommendation: Titrate slowly, close monitoring, patient education critical

novel_contributions.first_quantitative_dose_response: First mechanistic model quantifying CAI dose-response in IIH
novel_contributions.combination_synergy_quantification: 15% ICP, 10% PMD synergistic enhancement beyond additivity
novel_contributions.severity_stratified_precision: Distinct optimal strategies by baseline ICP severity
novel_contributions.clinical_actionability: NNT-based decision support for individualized dosing

limitations.model_based_evidence: Simulated outcomes, not RCT data (except IIHTT calibration)
limitations.patient_heterogeneity: Simplified response variability, real-world more complex
limitations.missing_data: Limited head-to-head TPM vs ACZ trials in humans
limitations.generalizability: Moderate-severity IIH primarily, may not apply to fulminant/mild extremes

future_research_priorities: RCT comparing ACZ 2g vs ACZ 2g + TPM 100mg in moderate-severe IIH
Precision dosing biomarkers (genetic, metabolic) for CAI response prediction
Long-term (2-5 year) outcomes of combination therapy
Novel CAI agents (methazolamide, zonisamide) comparative effectiveness

practice_changing: Combination therapy should be first-line in severe IIH (ICP >30)
Routine escalation beyond ACZ 2g not supported by dose-response data
TPM 100mg equivalent to ACZ 1g - consider in migraine comorbidity
Severity-stratified approach superior to one-size-fits-all dosing
guideline_updates_needed: Clarify role of TPM as first-line vs second-line
